poem:
Title: "Edifice of Promise, Derailed"

Beneath the Chancellor's syllabled dream,
A workbench of promise, daisy and dandelion spring,
Now falters, falls prey to tomorrows swept clean;
An edifice costs, not just in sterling.
How painted the picture, a thousand special hearts, 
In halls where time stood, whispering fresh starts,
Yet, cemented are echoes, progress departs – 
Education's ransom, in neglected parts.
